31 #include <limits>
32 #include "GPSZcount.hpp"
33 #include "CommandOptionParser.hpp"
34 
35 using namespace std;
36 using namespace gpstk;
37 
38 bool failure = false;
39 int verboseLevel = 0;
40 void say(const string& foo);
41 void process(bool result);
42 
43 //
44 // returns zero if all tests pass
45 //
46 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
47 {
48  // take care of command line options
49  CommandOptionNoArg hOption('h', "help", "Display this helpful information.",
50  false);
51  CommandOptionNoArg vOption('v', "verbose", "Increase the verbosity.",
52  false);
53  CommandOptionNoArg qOption('q', "quiet", "Only issue a return code.",
54  false);
55  CommandOptionParser cop("GPSZcount Test Suite");
56  cop.parseOptions(argc, argv);
57  if (cop.hasErrors())
58  {
59  cop.dumpErrors(cout);
60  cop.displayUsage(cout);
61  return 1;
62  }
63 
64  if(hOption.getCount())
65  {
66  cop.displayUsage(cout);
67  return 0;
68  }
69 
70  verboseLevel = vOption.getCount();
71 
72  try
73  {
74  // Proceed with testing
75  GPSZcount one, two;
76 
77  say("Equality Test: ");
78  process (one == two);
79 
80  say("Assignment Test 1: ");
81  one = GPSZcount(1000, 5);
82  process(one.getWeek() == 1000 &&
83  one.getZcount() == 5);
84 
85  say("Assignment Test 2: ");
86  try
87  {
88  // this should throw an exception
89  one.setZcount(GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_WEEK);
90  // if we get here, it failed
91  process(false);
92  }
93  catch (InvalidParameter& ip)
94  {
95  process(true);
96  }
97 
98  say("Addition Test: ");
99  one += GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_WEEK + 5 ;
100  process(one.getWeek() == 1001 &&
101  one.getZcount() == 10) ;
102 
103  say("Subtraction Test: ");
104  one -= GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_WEEK + 5 ;
105  process(one.getWeek() == 1000 &&
106  one.getZcount() == 5) ;
107 
108  say("Invalid Week Test 1: ");
109  one.setWeek(numeric_limits<short>::max());
110  try
111  {
112  // this should throw an exception
113  one += GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_WEEK;
114  // if we get here, it failed
115  process(false);
116  }
117  catch (InvalidRequest& ir)
118  {
119  process(true);
120  }
121 
122  say("Invalid Week Test 2: " );
123  one.setWeek(0);
124  try
125  {
126  // this should throw an exception
127  one -= GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_WEEK;
128  // if we get here, it failed
129  process(false);
130  }
131  catch (InvalidRequest& ir)
132  {
133  process(true);
134  }
135 
136  say("Less-Than Test: ");
137  one.setWeek(1000).setZcount(GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_WEEK / 2) ;
138  two = one + 5 ;
139  process(two >= one) ;
140 
141  say("Greater-Than Test: ") ;
142  two = one - 5 ;
143  process(two <= one) ;
144 
145  say("SameTimeBlock Test 1: ") ;
146  // set one to be at 4:20 and two at 4:00
147  one.setWeek(1200).setZcount(4 * GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_HOUR
148  + 20 * GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_MINUTE) ;
149  two.setWeek(1200).setZcount(4 * GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_HOUR) ;
150  // test if one and two are between 4:00 and 5:00
151  process(one.inSameTimeBlock(two, GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_HOUR)) ;
152 
153  say("SameTimeBlock Test 2: ") ;
154  // test if one and two are NOT between 4:20 and 4:21
155  process(! one.inSameTimeBlock(two, GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_MINUTE)) ;
156 
157  say("SameTimeBlock Test 3: ") ;
158  // test if one and two are NOT between 4:15 and 5:15
159  process(! one.inSameTimeBlock(two, GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_HOUR,
160  15 * GPSZcount::ZCOUNT_MINUTE)) ;
161 
162  say("Dump Test: ") ;
163  if (verboseLevel)
164  {
165  cout << endl << one << endl;
166  one.dump(cout, 1);
167  }
168 
169  say("String Test: ");
170  one.setWeek(1200).setZcount(123456);
171  process(string(one) == string("1200w123456z"));
172 
173  if (qOption.getCount() == 0)
174  {
175  // Display the overall results
176  cout << "GPSZcount Overall results: "
177  << (failure ? "Fail" : "Pass") << endl;
178  }
179 
180  return failure ? 1 : 0 ;
181  }
182  catch(gpstk::Exception& exc)
183  {
184  cout << endl << endl << "Caught a " << exc.getName() << " exception:"
185  << endl << exc << endl ;
186  return 1 ;
187  }
188 }
189 
190 void say(const string& foo)
191 {
192  if (verboseLevel)
193  cout << foo << flush;
194 }
195 
196 void process(bool result)
197 {
198  failure |= !result;
199 
200  if(verboseLevel)
201  {
202  cout << (result ? "Pass" : "Fail") << endl;
203  }
204 }
